channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Batten Down the Hatches—Dark Brandon Is Coming Back!
Chip Roy plans House discussion on 25th Amendment regarding Biden’s mental fitness
item.description: Rep. Chip Roy, R-Texas, is planning to speak with House Republicans on Tuesday about options under the 25th Amendment for removing President Biden from office.

item.title: Biden Campaign: Harris 'Increasing Her Role' in Reelection Effort
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has expressed her support for President Joe Biden following his widely panned debate performance and is "increasing her role" in the campaign ahead of the election this November, Cedric Richmond, co-chair of the Biden-Harris campaign, said.

item.title: Biden Question Scandal Brings Consequences for Radio Host and Earns Scathing Response From Station
Multiple ranking Democrats on House committees want Biden to step aside
item.description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries held a virtual meeting with ranking Democrats, where several attendees suggested President Biden should exit the presidential race.

item.title: Comer Demands WH Doctor Testify on Biden's Health
item.description: House Oversight Committee Chair James Comer demanded that White House physician Dr. Kevin O'Connor agree to an interview regarding possible efforts in helping the Biden family businesses and questioned the doctor's medical judgment concerning President Joe Biden.

item.title: Military Oddities I - Warfare on the Cheap: The Vespa Anti-Tank Scooter
Kristi Noem quietly deletes two state-affiliated social media accounts over holiday weekend: report
item.description: Republican South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem deleted her state-affiliated X and Facebook accounts without explanation, according to reports.

item.title: Radio Host Resigns After Asking Biden Scripted Questions
item.description: Radio host Andrea Lawful-Sanders has resigned in what The New York Times reported was a mutual decision with her Philadelphia radio station, WURD, after she asked President Joe Biden questions on Wednesday that were provided by his team.

item.title: France's Left Pulls Off Shocking Comeback Finishing First in Parliamentary Elections
Kamala Harris' husband Doug Emhoff tests positive for COVID: White House
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' husband Douglas Emhoff recently tested positive for COVID-19, according to a White House press release. Emhoff has taken three COVID-19 boosters.

item.title: House Democrats Call on Biden to Drop Out of Race
item.description: As the Democrats' pressure on Joe Biden to step aside continues following the first presidential debate on June 27, several ranking lawmakers on Sunday told House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries that the president needs to step aside, CNN reported.

item.title: Biden Displays Scary Look During Visit to Black Church, and What the Bishop Said Is Raising Eyebrows
Biden notes 'world's looking to America' as he faces scrutiny before hosting NATO summit
item.description: President Biden, facing scrutiny about his mental fitness ahead of the NATO summit in Washington, D.C., told a Philadelphia Black church the "world's looking to America."

item.title: Sen. Graham: Worried About Biden in Office Next 4 Months
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., told CBS News on Sunday that he's "worried about [Joe] Biden being the commander in chief for the next four months," following the president's shaky, halting performance in the first presidential debate last month.
